definition: to attend a meeting as a nonvoting delegate
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: The Chief Executive may, as he or she deems necessary, invite other persons concerned to sit in on meetings of the Council.
sentences.chinese: 行政长官认为必要时可邀请有关人士列席会议。

sentences.english: There were 9 people in attendance and three of them are of "elevated and notable repute".
sentences.chinese: 共有9人列席，其中三位是“明显升高和声望”。

sentences.english: The supervisors shall be present at board meetings.
As chairman of the board, the enterprise assistant attend to participate.
sentences.chinese: 东盛董事会，田野作为董事长助理列席参与。

sentences.english: Kings and queens wear crowns at official ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 国王和女王列席官方典礼时戴王冠。

sentences.english: People can sit in on meetings, even if it's not really in their subject area.
sentences.chinese: 即使不在其研究专题范围之内，人们也可以列席会议。

sentences.english: I nominate her to present us at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 本人引荐她代表本人们列席会议。

sentences.english: Sheer level likely to cause confusion, appropriate easy sound volume level. Power politics can be changed from five to eight, and attached two attend.
sentences.chinese: 大国政治能否由五个变为八个，并附加两个列席国。

sentences.english: He represented his fellow-workers at the union meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他代表工友们列席工会会议。

sentences.english: and (6) To designate officials to sit in on the meetings of the Legislative Council and to speak on behalf of the government.
sentences.chinese: 委派官员列席立法会并代表政府发言。

sentences.english: There are circuit judges and recorders who sit in the County courts, usually without a jury.
sentences.chinese: 由巡回法官和特委法官列席的县法院通常不设陪审团。

sentences.english: We are glad if you can come to attend our meeting.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能列席我们的会议我们将很高兴。

sentences.english: I attended many social functions while working abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我在外洋任务时期列席了很多交际会。

sentences.english: Two parents, one from each side, are in attendance.
sentences.chinese: 两个家长，每方一均列席。

definition: to visit (a meeting, class, trial etc)
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
general congress/meeting of the whole committee
to receive sb/to grant an interview
